title: Delta mutation is no reason to panic — but Covid vaccination remains crucial, scientists say
content:
1. Delta mutation is no reason to panic — but Covid vaccination remains crucial, scientists say  CNBC
  2. Covid: Double vaccinated can still spread virus at home  BBC News
  3. UK study finds vaccinated people easily transmit Delta variant in households  Yahoo News
  4. WHO is now closely tracking a delta subvariant found in 42 countries to see if it's more transmissible  MarketWatch
  5. Local experts discuss declining COVID cases: ‘We may have turned a corner’  WJHL-TV News Channel 11
contentSnippet:
Delta mutation is no reason to panic — but Covid vaccination remains crucial, scientists say  CNBC
Covid: Double vaccinated can still spread virus at home  BBC News
UK study finds vaccinated people easily transmit Delta variant in households  Yahoo News
WHO is now closely tracking a delta subvariant found in 42 countries to see if it's more transmissible  MarketWatch
Local experts discuss declining COVID cases: ‘We may have turned a corner’  WJHL-TV News Channel 11

localize.title: デルタ線の突然変異はパニックの原因にならないが、Covidワクチンの接種は引き続き重要であると科学者は言う。
科学家们说，三角洲突变不是恐慌的理由--但接种Covid疫苗仍然至关重要
科學家們說，三角洲突變不是恐慌的理由--但接種Covid疫苗仍然至關重要
